A9: By the end, the film becomes indistinguishable from all those movies it's trying so hard to disown.

Q1: Who is Piero Schivazappa?
A1: Piero Schivazappa is an Italian film and television director and screenwriter.

Q2: When was Piero Schivazappa born?
A2: Piero Schivazappa was born on April 14, 1935.

Q3: What kind of films has Piero Schivazappa made?
A3: Piero Schivazappa has made a variety of films, including feature films and television movies and series.

Q4: Who are some of the people that Schivazappa has collaborated with in the film industry?
A4: Schivazappa has collaborated with directors such as Valerio Zurlini, Mario Monicelli, and Carlo Lizzani, among others.

Q5: What is the name of Schivazappa's first feature film?
A5: Piero Schivazappa's first feature film was "The Laughing Woman" (1969).

Q6: What is the name of the erotic drama that Schivazappa directed in 1986?
A6: The erotic drama that Schivazappa directed in 1986 is titled "La signora della notte".

Q7: Is Piero Schivazappa married to an actress?
A7: Yes, Piero Schivazappa is married to actress Scilla Gabel.

Q8: Can you provide a list of some of Schivazappa's selected filmography?
A8: Sure! Here is a list of some of Schivazappa's selected filmography: "L'Odissea" (TV, 1968), "The Laughing Woman" (1969), "Una sera c'incontrammo" (1975), "Dov'è Anna?" (TV, 1976), and "An American Love" (TV, 1994).

Q9: What is the name of the miniseries that Schivazappa directed in the late 1970s?
A9: The miniseries that Schivazappa directed in the late 1970s is titled "Vino e pane".

Q10: How many children does Piero Schivazappa have?
A10: According to the passage, Piero Schivazappa has two children.

Q1: Who was Edward J. Yates?
A1: Edward J. Yates was an American television director who directed the ABC television program "American Bandstand" from 1952 until 1969.

Q2: When did Edward Yates become a director of "American Bandstand"?
A2: Edward Yates became the director of "American Bandstand" in October 1952.

Q3: What was the name of the show when Edward Yates started directing it?
A3: The show was called "Bandstand" when Edward Yates started directing it.

Q4: How long did Edward Yates work on "American Bandstand"?
A4: Edward Yates worked on "American Bandstand" from 1952 until 1969, for a total of 17 years.

Q5: What was the name of the host of "American Bandstand" when Edward Yates started directing it?
A5: The host of "American Bandstand" when Edward Yates started directing it was Bob Horn.

Q6: Who took over as the host of "American Bandstand" in 1956?
A6: Dick Clark took over as the host of "American Bandstand" in 1956.

Q7: Where did Edward Yates move to after he retired from "American Bandstand"?
A7: After retiring from "American Bandstand", Edward Yates moved his family to the Philadelphia suburb of West Chester.

Q8: When did Edward Yates die?
A8: Edward Yates died in 2006 at a nursing home where he had been for the last two months of his life.
